title: Rishikesh Explorer Tour
description: A five-day immersive tour of Rishikesh — explore its spiritual sites, riverside markets, cultural heritage, and serene yoga experiences.
highlights: Guided evening Ganga Aarti ceremony at Triveni Ghat
Visit ancient temples and the Beatles Ashram (Chaurasi Kutia)
Optional evening yoga or meditation session by the Ganges
Local walking tour through Rishikesh town and markets
Short rafting or riverside strolls (optional and seasonal)
includes: 4 nights accommodation in a comfortable guesthouse or hotel
Daily breakfast and one welcome herbal meal
All guided tours and entry fees to Beatles Ashram and temples
Transfers from and to Jolly Grant Airport, Dehradun
Local English-speaking guide
importantInfo: Dress modestly for temple visits and Ganges ceremonies
Footwear removal required at religious sites—carry easy slip-ons
Ganga Aarti may involve crowds—follow guide instructions
Yoga is optional; bring a yoga mat or notify us to provide one
Accessible for most travelers—inform us of mobility needs ahead

reviews.name: Anjali Verma
reviews.text: Loved the balance between cultural exploration and peaceful moments by the Ganges. Our guide made it enriching!

reviews.name: Rohit Singh
reviews.text: Beautiful variety of experiences—ashram, market, riverside walks. A little more food variety would've been nice.

reviews.name: Meera Patel
reviews.text: Such a soulful trip with a lively town vibe. Perfect introduction to Rishikesh.

title: Kedarkantha Summit Trek
description: A classic Uttarakhand winter trek to the panoramic Kedarkantha summit — scenic trails, alpine camps and village hospitality.
highlights: Summit at sunrise with sweeping Himalayan views
Night camping with hot meals and campfire
Short village visits to experience local mountain life
Professional guide, basic mountaineering support and porter assistance
Suitable for intermediate trekkers with good fitness
includes: All trek permits and park fees
Tented camping accommodation on trek nights
Meals during trek (breakfast, packed lunch, dinner)
Experienced mountain guide and porters for luggage
Transfer from Dehradun/Delhi to trailhead (as per itinerary)
Basic first-aid kit and emergency support
excludes: Personal trekking gear (sleeping bag, gaiters) — rental available
All flights and long-distance transfers not in itinerary
Any extra nights accommodation before/after the trek
importantInfo: Trek altitude reaches ~3800m; moderate-to-high fitness required
Seasonal: snowy window typically Dec–Mar for snow, summer alternative available
Carry warm layers, waterproof jacket and sturdy trekking boots
Medical clearance recommended for participants with cardiac or respiratory issues
Group size limited to preserve trail experience

reviews.name: Karan Mehta
reviews.text: A tough but rewarding trek. Guides were excellent, food was surprisingly good on the trail and the views from the summit are unforgettable.

reviews.name: Tara Joshi
reviews.text: Well-organized, safe and the campsites were comfortable. Highly recommended for anyone wanting a true Himalayan experience.

reviews.name: Aman Kapoor
reviews.text: Great route and scenery. Would advise more snacks on summit day, otherwise excellent guide team.

title: Uttarakhand Heritage & Hills Circuit
description: A relaxed circuit across Uttarakhand hill towns — colonial hill stations, scenic lakes, and Kumaoni culture and cuisine.
highlights: Boat ride on Naini Lake and local craft markets in Nainital
Sunrise viewpoints in Kausani or Binsar (seasonal)
Walks through colonial-era Mussoorie and Landour lanes
Cultural interactions and local food tasting
Comfortable hotels and short scenic drives
includes: Accommodation in 3–4 star hotels (5 nights)
Daily breakfast and selected meals as per itinerary
Private vehicle and driver for the full circuit
Local guide for cultural walks and sightseeing
All local taxes and standard entry fees
excludes: Flights to Dehradun and return transfers to origin
meetingPoint: Dehradun city center or Jolly Grant Airport (DED)
importantInfo: Pace is relaxed with short drives and light walks
Some days include uneven footpaths and hill steps — bring comfortable shoes
Altitude is low to moderate, suitable for most travelers
Local cuisine may contain dairy and spices; advise dietary needs early
Peak tourist months: Apr–Jun and Sep–Nov

reviews.name: Nitika Rao
reviews.text: Lovely mix of nature and culture. The guide arranged an authentic Kumaoni meal which was a highlight.

reviews.name: Vikram Das
reviews.text: Good hotels and friendly driver. Could include more time in Almora next time.

reviews.name: Simran Kaur
reviews.text: Beautiful hill views and calm lakes. Perfect short getaway from the city.

title: Jim Corbett Wildlife Safari
description: A short wildlife escape to Jim Corbett National Park with guided jeep safaris, birdwatching and comfortable lodge stays.
highlights: Early morning and late afternoon jeep safaris in different zones
Expert naturalist guiding wildlife and bird identification
Comfortable eco-friendly lodge accommodation
Optional nature walks and village visits
Photography opportunities and evening presentations
includes: All park permits and safari bookings (as per itinerary)
2 nights accommodation in a wildlife lodge
Meals during the stay (breakfast/lunch/dinner)
Jeep safaris with trained naturalist guide
Transfers from nearest pick-up point included
excludes: Personal camera charges or extra photography permits
Tips for naturalists and lodge staff
Alcoholic beverages (if not part of lodge package)
meetingPoint: Ramnagar (gateway for Jim Corbett National Park)
importantInfo: Wildlife sightings cannot be guaranteed — Corbett is a protected wilderness
Follow all park rules: no loud noises, no littering, no leaving vehicle during safari
Bring binoculars and a long lens for photography
Children under 5 may have restricted access on safaris per park rules
Keep personal medicines and insect repellent handy

reviews.name: Sonal Gupta
reviews.text: Amazing biodiversity and well-managed safaris. Saw many birds and even spotted deer close to the jeep.

reviews.name: Arjun Nair
reviews.text: Good lodge and friendly staff. Safari timings were perfect for photography.

reviews.name: Farah Khan
reviews.text: Great trip for wildlife lovers. Guides are very knowledgeable about local fauna.

title: Haridwar Sacred Short Break
description: A short and soulful itinerary centred around Haridwar — witness the iconic Ganga Aarti, visit temples and enjoy guided spiritual walks.
highlights: Witness the evening Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri
Short guided heritage walk through old Haridwar lanes
Boat ride along the calmer stretches of the Ganges
Optional Ayurvedic massage or wellness session
Local devotional music and cultural interaction
includes: 1 night accommodation in a centrally located hotel
Breakfast and a welcome meal
Guided Ganga Aarti visit and cultural walk
Transfers from Dehradun or Haridwar railway station
Local guide and entry fees for scheduled sites
excludes: Personal shopping and donations at temples
meetingPoint: Haridwar city center (Har Ki Pauri area)
importantInfo: Respect local customs: modest clothing and quiet behaviour near ghats and temples
Ganga Aarti can be crowded — follow the guide’s instructions
Accessible to travellers of most fitness levels
Wear comfortable footwear; some areas have steps and uneven ground
Carry a small torch for evening walks if needed

reviews.name: Pooja Deshpande
reviews.text: Such a moving experience — the Aarti felt very authentic and our guide explained everything clearly.

reviews.name: Viren Patel
reviews.text: Short and sweet trip, perfect for a weekend spiritual reset.

reviews.name: Deepa Rana
reviews.text: Loved the local interactions and the food. The boat ride was peaceful at dawn.

title: Valley of Flowers & Hemkund Sahib Trek
description: A high-altitude alpine trek to the UNESCO-like meadows of Valley of Flowers, combined with a spiritual visit to Hemkund Sahib.
highlights: Walk through vast alpine meadows carpeted with seasonal wildflowers
Visit the sacred Hemkund Sahib gurudwara set beside a glacial lake
Experience the remote high-altitude culture of Chamoli region
Moderate trekking days with scenic campsite stays
Ideal for nature photographers and flowering-plant enthusiasts
includes: All forest and trekking permits required for Valley of Flowers
Accommodation in basecamp/guesthouses and tented nights on trek
Meals during trek and local transport as per itinerary
Experienced trekking guide and porters for group luggage
Pre-trek briefing, basic medical kit and emergency evacuation plan
excludes: Personal trekking gear and sleeping bags (rental available)
Travel insurance that covers high-altitude trekking
Airfare and railway tickets to Dehradun/Haridwar
meetingPoint: Govindghat (gateway village for Valley of Flowers & Hemkund)
importantInfo: Seasonal operation: best flowering months July–September (Valley closed in winter)
Trek reaches altitudes ~4000m; good fitness required
Carry warm clothing and waterproof layers (weather changes fast)
Respect fragile flora: do not pick flowers or stray from marked trails
A note on altitude sickness: acclimatize and stay hydrated

reviews.name: Rina Bose
reviews.text: An otherworldly place — colours and calm unlike anywhere else. Guides took great care of the group.

reviews.name: Sandeep Malik
reviews.text: Beautiful route and well-paced days. Hemkund was spiritually moving and the campsite food was hearty.

reviews.name: Lata Sharma
reviews.text: Nature at its best. Do come prepared — some steep stretches but the scenery compensates for the effort.
